page.title: 11 Farms part 1
page.content: Carldane Court and Chaldean Farm are mentioned in the Domesday Book. Carldane Court used to be two small cottages, with a family living in each cottage. The first record of it is in 1100. The Bishop of London owned it for 60 years. He had a servant called Roderick. He was a very faithful servant so the Bishop gave him 130 acres, including the court.Roderick called it"Keldene" which in English means service to the King.The Parnell Family bought some of it and held it for 300 years.In the early 1900's most of the Parnell Family died.A cousin of the family, named Crallon inherited it. He was a professional architect and woodcraftsman and he was the one who enlarged the cottages to almost what they are today.He did a lot of carving and oak pannelling which can still be seen. The timberwork is good.
